issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

fields.description: one scenario when we want this new config: we want to enforce min replication of value 2, when client try to create a file, it's check against the replication factor of the new config, which is set to 2,  so that client can not create a file of replication of 1. But when client try to close file and there are some datanode failures in the pipeline and only 1 datanode remain, it is checked against old minReplication value, which has value 1, so we will allow client to close the file.
fields.summary: separate replication config for client to create a file or set replication

This message was automatically generated.

I think it makes more sense to use the existing configuration option, {{dfs.client.block.write.replace-datanode-on-failure.best-effort}}, instead.  Setting this configuration option will allow you to successfully close the repl=2 file even if it can only be replicated to 1 DN.
Hi [~cmccabe], thanks for comment. What I am trying to achieve is to separate the min replication factor to enforce when create a file and the min replication factor to check when complete block.
added a unit test to test changes in verifyReplication, which is only used by create file and set replication for a file

I thought client-side only change would be simpler and flexible, especially if believe occasional violation of minimum replication is not a critical correctness problem.
